It is undeniably true that existing Variables can oly be built from an existing Tensor. And it is expected behavior. whether it is desirable behavior is less clear:

  • per the docs: "Variable API is nearly the same as regular Tensor API (with the exception of a couple in-place methods, that would overwrite inputs required for gradient computation)."
  • in practice, it would likely be trivial to add code to the Variable cosntructor, that checks if the incoming Value is a Tensor, and sends ti to the Tensor constructor, if it's not

body:
It is undeniably true that existing Variables can oly be built from an existing Tensor.  And it is expected behavior.  whether it is desirable behavior is less clear:
- per the docs: "Variable API is nearly the same as regular Tensor API (with the exception of a couple in-place methods, that would overwrite inputs required for gradient computation)."
- in practice, it would likely be trivial to add code to the `Variable` cosntructor, that checks if the incoming Value is a `Tensor`, and sends ti to the `Tensor` constructor, if it's not
